unit_learning_outcomes.description: Use formal mathematical methods to design, model and validate solutions to computational problems.
Understand the theoretical limitations of computing devices and the problems that can be solved by a computer.
Communicate mathematical arguments incorporating deductive reasoning, particularly in areas concerning how computer programs work.
Apply a broad range of standard mathematical techniques used in computer science.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Studying and reviewing from lecture slides, online resources and text books. Preparing for SGTA classes.

enrolment_rules.description: MATH1007 or MATH1020 or MATH1025 or DMTH137 or MATH133 or MATH136

assessments.description: Solve a more involved project based problem, explain your solution and communicate your results in a clear and logical manner.
The quizzes are competency tests to ensure that all students who pass this unit possess certain basic skills.
Solve a given set of questions and communicate your results in a clear and logical way in writing.

The unit is structured as three modules. At the end of each module students complete a module exam which is offered during their SGTA class. They are offered a second opportunity to complete a different version of each module exam during the final exam period. If a student makes two attempts at an exam for a module, the final mark awarded is the maximum of the marks attained in each attempt.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: The purpose of this unit is to give a grounding in discrete mathematics. It is important preparation for theoretical computing, software engineering and abstract algebra. The unit explores topics in areas such as computability and computational complexity; formal languages and finite state machines; recurrence relations and generating functions; computational applications of graphs, trees and matrices; and formal methods in programming.
data.title: Discrete Mathematics II

description: The purpose of this unit is to give a grounding in discrete mathematics. It is important preparation for theoretical computing, software engineering and abstract algebra. title: Discrete Mathematics II
